definition: Feminism is being aware and supportive of women and their historical struggle - while feeling good about being masculine. It's not one or the other, both are possible and worth pursuing. Anyone who says otherwise is bitter.
What do you need today? Be direct
Men and women can be equally as monstrous. Challenge people who say women are better than men, same as you would vice versa.
Gregg Wallace is one man, Marie Le Pen is one woman.
Mums don't "always know" - nobody does.
You're annoying, extremely stubborn and independent, lazy, frustratingly slow, rude, inconsistent, moody - but clearly loved a lot despite this.

Making music is a great way to spend your time, no matter your current state of employment. However, without a life outside of your creations, the music will probably be boring. What you channel into music - work, love, life stories or otherwise - is what makes it interesting.
I don’t care what age my friends are. Why would I hang out with someone my own age I don’t like, rather than someone younger or older that I do? I like a broad range of perspectives.
It's ok to feel pain and need a way to vent, it's a natural part of being human, but do your best to do something with forward momentum.
An unexamined life is to live by other people’s standards.
Don’t necessarily take the obvious choice -  go for what specifically you want.
Look at life like an ongoing piece of music. The point isn't the crescendo, the man with the two crashing cymbals at the end
“In my music, I'm trying to play the truth of what I am. The reason it's difficult is because I'm changing all the time.”

Frame Justifying: trying to mitigate or explain why your status is better than it looks, anxiously. A form of reframing. Eg. ‘I work in hospitality but I’m an Assistant General Manager with a salary.’ Eg. ‘I’m a rich kid but I’ve made my own way and had no help. Self made man.’ We try to cover up low status chips to our frame. This only comes across as insecure. Be honest and direct. ‘I have some wealth, I pursued my passion in my 20s. Who wouldn’t?’. No reframing.

Accolades and achievements are seductive for your self worth. It's tempting to fall back on these in hard times ‘well at least I did x, y or z’ - but take with a pinch of salt. Same with attaching negative self esteem to bad past experiences ‘I fucked up a, b or c’. Allow the little buzz or sting from either, but don't let it consume
We’re all going to die. Houses will be ruins, successes forgotten. What should you care about?

Is sex to you proving you are on a high, or higher rung of the ladder than either you are, or claim to be? Is sex an anxious peacock display of status - what kind of person will you attract if you beleive this? Cynical attracts cynical.

Productivity is not just economic. Self-anaylsing and reflecting, taking time in isolation to confront yourself and your fears, for instance, could yield high rewards such as improved self-worth from a small investment, like a walk in the park.

To me, a loser is someone who lives by a set of values not their own, not taking risks, confronting themselves in order to grow. In order to know your values however, you may need to go through phases of being a “loser”, be tested, to realize what your values even are. It's ok to have a bumpy ride, we're all losers sometimes.
Be a socialist who isn't an idealist. An artist who isn't mad
Would you be offended if a gnat bit you?

Learning is a love of knowing. You could do this as a child, adult, or old person. Even if you had a year to live, if learning was what you wanted then do it, even if you never get to use it. It’s ok to just enjoy learning for it’s own sake.
A broad range of friends gives a broad range of perspectives. Age, culture, gender, sexual preferences
The arc of the conversation is often more interesting than the conclusion. Philosophy is exercise not truth
There is no true belief system, we wander from belief to belief, using it as a lens to help us understand ourselves.
What sort of person do you want to be like?
Don’t prove yourself. Live by your own values and don't attach yourself to your frame. If how you seem is rotten to one person or group, it's almost certainly great to someone else.
Men can be sensitive and passionate. Many ways to be masculine.

Too much emphasis on quantity: how many records does this DJ own; how many books have you read on this or that subject. I don't need to see and hear it all, if it means sacrificing the depth of understanding from listening to the same thing multiple times. No one likes a mr or miss know it all who's always putting their hand up.
Are you judging anyone for their status, health, age, beauty or anything else?
I value art, music, creative writing etc. as non-money making. They are for my own exploration
Help yourself and your kids first, then other adults. What do you need today?
Cats behave as the flawed, greedy, energetic, selfish characters they often are. We love them for it, even if it drives us mad.
"Still single?" is like asking "still in a relationship?". Much more important is are you happy or doing a good job in either one.
Accept all parts of yourself, especially the darker, repressed parts
It's ok to surrender sometimes. You fucked it. Everyone does from time to time, you're not impervious
If you make a committment today to someone, be conscious of it and keep it
Appreciate your loved ones now, even if they're a pain. You'll only have them once. Relish being annoyed with them.
If you did not care what that snooty person in your life thought about it, how would you behave differently?
Don't wait, get it over with.
Try to be on time today.
What's something fun or sweet you want to do for a loved one today, expecting absolutely nothing in return?
What are you scared of at the moment? Face it and do it.

What if we took all appearances about two people you know, everything about them as objects in the real world including job, attractiveness, health etc. and swappped them, same people underneath, theoretically. What's left underneath both, do they deserve equal respect?

Rungs on ladders: steadily climbing; tearfully slipping; anxiously clinging. At the top, I'd 'make it' - but make what? A loft conversion, an IKEA showroom filled with browsers: love only for my finances; friends only of my successes. If you let go of this ladder to heaven, you'll be surprised when you're legs don't break.
Approach potential lovers with curiosity
I don't believe a girl needs to be successful, have high status, great material assets or money in the bank, for me to love her. I'd like to find someone with the same values about men.

Men keep saying - 'women only want men with large salaries'. I used to think there were many qualities that make any person of any gender attractive, not just status - but I'm sure these men have met every woman out there.
Do you enjoy false modesty in others? Or anxious boasting? Honesty, humour, comfortable vulnerability are better.

Being single is great. You wake up, you eat some eggs, go to the movies, go out, maybe have some sex. Being in a relationship is great. You wake up, you eat some eggs, go to the movies, go out, maybe have some sex.
Don't assume, make your own conclusions. Otherwise, you could get trapped in horse shit
Stop trying to 'be sensible' and expect results. There is no contract that guarantees this. What's something only you would think to do?
Opportunites and options kill desperation and regret. How can you give yourself more opportunites or options?
I'm superficial. I care about status, impressions, looks, but I try to take it with a pinch of salt. My nature as a human being is flawed, but I'll keep trying and hopefully get better over time.
I'm sorry to break the bad news, but there's a good chance you're going to die at some point. What's something worth caring about in the mean time, considering this?
